knowseqpy.utils package

Submodules

knowseqpy.utils.common module

Common utility functions for working with CSV files and data structures.

knowseqpy.utils.common.calculate_specificity(conf_matrix: array) → float[source]

Calculates specificity for each class in a binary or multiclass classification and returns the average.

Parameters:

conf_matrix – The confusion matrix of the model.

Returns:

The average specificity across all classes.

knowseqpy.utils.common.csv_to_dataframe(path_components: list[str], index_col=None, header=None, **kwargs: Any) → DataFrame[source]

Loads a CSV file into a pandas DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • path_components – List of components in the file path.

  • index_col – Column(s) to use as the row labels (index). Defaults to None.

  • header – Row number(s) to use as the column names. Defaults to None.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments to pass to pandas.read_csv().

Returns:

pandas DataFrame containing the CSV data.

Raises:

  • FileNotFoundError – If the CSV file is not found at the specified path.

  • pd.errors.ParserError – If there is an issue with CSV parsing.

knowseqpy.utils.common.csv_to_list(path_components: list[str]) → list[source]

Loads a CSV file into a list.

Parameters:

path_components – List of components in the file path.

Returns:

A list where each element is a row of the CSV.

knowseqpy.utils.common.dataframe_to_feather(data: DataFrame, filepath: Path, **kwargs) → None[source]

Saves a pandas DataFrame to a Feather file using pathlib paths.

Parameters:

  • data – pandas DataFrame with data.

  • filepath – Pathlib object representing the path to the file.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments to pass to pandas.DataFrame.to_feather().

knowseqpy.utils.common.feather_to_dataframe(filepath: Path, **kwargs) → DataFrame[source]

Loads a Feather file into a pandas DataFrame using pathlib paths.

Parameters:

  • filepath – Pathlib object representing the path to the Feather file.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments to pass to pandas.read_feather().

Returns:

pandas DataFrame containing the Feather file data.

knowseqpy.utils.common.get_project_path() → Path[source]

Retrieves the directory of the project.

Returns:

A Path object pointing to the project’s root directory.

Return type:

Path

knowseqpy.utils.common.get_test_path() → Path[source]

Retrieves the directory of the project’s test folder.

Returns:

A Path object pointing to the project’s test directory.

Return type:

Path

knowseqpy.utils.logger module

knowseqpy.utils.logger.get_logger()[source]
knowseqpy.utils.logger.set_logger(enable_file_logging=False, log_level=20, propagate=True)[source]

knowseqpy.utils.plotting module

Data Visualization Module using Plotly.

knowseqpy.utils.plotting.another_plot_decision_tree(model: Pipeline, vars_selected: list)[source]

Plots the decision tree from the trained model pipeline.

Parameters:

  • model – A trained model pipeline that includes preprocessing and the classifier.

  • vars_selected – List of feature names used in training.

Returns:

None. Displays the plot of the decision tree.

knowseqpy.utils.plotting.plot_boxplot(data: DataFrame, labels: Series, fs_ranking: list, top_n_features: int = 5, png_filename: str = None) → None[source]

Plots a boxplot of the top N features from the feature selection ranking.

Parameters:

  • data – Data containing samples in rows and features in columns.

  • labels – Labels for the samples.

  • fs_ranking – List of feature names ordered by ranking.

  • top_n_features – Number of top features to include in the boxplot. Defaults to 5.

  • png_filename – Filename for the exported PNG file. If not None, the plot is exported with the given name. Defaults to None.

knowseqpy.utils.plotting.plot_confusion_matrix(conf_matrix: ndarray, unique_labels: list, png_filename: str = None) → None[source]

Plots a confusion matrix of classified samples.

Parameters:

  • conf_matrix (array-like) – The confusion matrix to be plotted.

  • unique_labels – Labels for the samples.

  • png_filename – Filename for the exported PNG file. If not None, the plot is exported with the given name. Defaults to None.

knowseqpy.utils.plotting.plot_decision_boundary(model: Pipeline, data: DataFrame, labels: Series, vars_selected: list) → None[source]

Plots the decision boundary of a logistic regression model.

Parameters:

  • model – A trained logistic regression model pipeline.

  • data – The feature matrix.

  • labels – True labels for the data.

  • vars_selected – Selected features for classification.

knowseqpy.utils.plotting.plot_decision_tree(model: Pipeline, labels: Series, vars_selected: list) → None[source]

Plots the decision tree from the trained model pipeline using plotly.

Parameters:

  • model – A trained model pipeline that includes preprocessing and the classifier.

  • labels – True labels for the test data.

  • vars_selected – Selected genes for classification. Can be DEGs or a custom list.

Returns:

None. Displays the plot of the decision tree.

knowseqpy.utils.plotting.plot_samples_heatmap(data: DataFrame, labels: Series, fs_ranking: list, top_n_features: int = 5, png_filename: str = None) → None[source]

Plots a heatmap of the top N features from the feature selection ranking.

Parameters:

  • data – Data containing samples in rows and features in columns.

  • labels – Labels for the samples.

  • fs_ranking – List of feature names ordered by ranking.

  • top_n_features – Number of top features to include in the heatmap. Defaults to 5.

  • png_filename – Filename for the exported PNG file. If not None, the plot is exported with the given name. Defaults to None.
